discourse_list.title: Zero Gas Architecture for Liquidity Providers

content.content: Zero Gas Architecture for Liquidity Providers and Near Zero for Liquidity Consumers: Hopefully the following is already in the roadmap. Create UX that is least gas intensive to keep the community exchanging majorly in UNI. This would create an extremely sticky community.
content.GPT-summary: The post explains a proposal for a "Zero Gas Architecture" for liquidity providers and consumers to keep the community exchanging in UNI with the least gas consumption. The author hopes that this proposal is already in the roadmap and suggests that it would create a sticky community. A 3rd party gives constructive criticism by asking questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I agree that for LP’s the gas fees can be pretty high and maybe turns away a lot of potential liquidity providers. It would be a good idea to incentivize more LP’s with lower to no gas fees if they hold a certain amount of UNI tokens. I’m open to discussion in regards to this
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: Hopefully Ethereum 2.0. will solve the high gas issues

I think we should do zero gas architecture for any project, as an incentive other projects to sign up with Uniswap. I don’t know how it works exactly, so I am not completely sure but if it doesn’t cost us or the platform more than I’m for it. But if it does have some sort of cost then yea, they should hold a certain amount of UNI tokens.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
